Articles.Content:
I need to attach spaceplanes from SPH to a rocket in VAB radially with decouplers. The planes are identical so symmetry will do.

But I can't make the middle section of the fuselage a root part to save it as subassembly, as there are no free nodes. Neither I can do the same with radial decouplers I slapped on the belly. Got an easy solution?

 

EDIT: nevermind, got it working. I definitely didn't find the best solution (or one that's easy to describe). It involved saving three different subassemblies and playing domino with them and the carrier rocket.

Edited February 5, 2016 by Evanitis
One inelegant way to belly-attach a spaceplane as you describe is to put a BZ-52 attachment point on it, and make that the root part. Then save as subassembly.

Ugh. That would mean an extra part / plane... I rather play puzzle.

My solution was to add decouplers on the rocket and a jet-fuselage on it. Than I took the plane apart, and saved the back and front segment separately to put it back together in the VAB. That way it could be saved as subassembly grabbed by the 'coupler. Pretty counter-intuitive way - not that it's a construction I can justify to build every day.
That's why I prefer the merge button now. I can always merge anything, then shift-click to tear it apart appropriately to attach to my current ship.
